page.title: 05John Wilson-Patten (2)
page.content: By 1870 Colonel Wilson-Patten M.P. was resident in Winmarleigh and the improvements started about 1850 gathered pace and in a few short years he built the School (1870),the Hall (1871),the Church (1876),to which he added a new aisle in 1887 Jubilee Year,and a Vicarage. Unfotunately both his sons predeceased him and his grandson and sole male heir,John Alfred, died at 21 in 1889. Thus Colonel John Wilson-Patten, who was created Baron Winmarleigh in 1874, was the First (and last) Lord Winmarleigh. He died on 11th July 1892,aged 90, at Winmarleigh Hall.Unlike his grandson, who 3 years previously had been buried at Winmarleigh,His Lordship was taken to Warrington Parish Church to be buried in the Patten Vault.
